name: HALP!
description: HALP! is a single-player VR sandbox puzzle game where you help a stranded scavenger pirate captain fix his broken ship before spaceworms attack... or where you DON'T do that and just enjoy poking around and messing with the ship's various gizmos and contraptions.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 or later Processor: Intel i5-4590 or AMD FX 8350 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX970 or AMD Radeon R9 290 Storage: 1 GB available space Additional Notes: One available USB 2.0 connection required, controller
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 SP1 or later Processor: Intel i7-5930X or greater Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce GTX 980 or greater Storage: 1 GB available space Additional Notes: USB 2.0 slot, controller, headphones

reviews.review_text: crazy experience, right up there with 'The Lab' and 'Waltz of the Wizard'. Just grab it already, and do not rush through it! Enjoy your stay, experiment with all the stuff you can do!

A bit short but free so I won't complain. Very original concept and creative realization with lots of attention to detail. Hopefully there will be a full game in this vein to follow. Extra props for the brief irritation about an extra in-game Vive motion controller and destructible credits! :-D
This is on my top 10 list of best VR experiences. I love the use of space!
still very early and buggy, but this has potential!

After playing with it and reading some other's posts, the room-scale issue I originally complained about is mainly fixed with recentering. For the Vive it is supposed to be the grip buttons, but I could not get that to work. I used a gamepad to do it, even though a gamepad is not listed on the store page as being supported.  Also, the left and right hand switch when entering the game, which is not good. Tried it several times and rebooted my system, and every time it switched hands. It's a little unnerving when your thumbs are pointing the wrong way!  Graphics are amazing, however, so I really hope they fix the issues and if it becomes more polished, this will absolutely be a recommended game.
Fun and free, what is not to like?
